724940f-a.title: Manhattan: Grand Street - Henry Street - Columbia Street.
724940f-a.text:
At the intersection of Grand (right) and Henry (left) at Columbia Streets. The frame structure (No. 527 G-and and 327 Henry Streets), shown directly at the apex, is A.N. Gilbert's Drug Store. The Spire shown on the left, is that of All Saints Free Church (Episcopal), which is located at the S.E. corner of
Henry and Scammel Streets.

April 1929.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
724940f-a.folder: Grand Street & Henry Street & Columbia Street., Manhattan, NY

720384f-b.text:
(1)
327 and 325 Henry Street, at and adioining its junction with Grand Street. The 3-story frame building (No. 327) at the corner also bears No. 527 Grand Street and forms the apex of the afore-mentioned junction. No. 325, the 1-story frame house is at the rear of No. 525 Grand Street; a 3-story frame house. Contiguous to it is a 1-story frame addition used as a garage which bears no number. IIt is at the rear of 523 Grand Street, a frame building with a rear wall made of brick. Also shown (extreme right) is No. 530 Grand Street, north side, between Columbia and Cannon Streets.
June 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A portion of the same, at a later date, showing a more inclusive view of No. 325.
March 23, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

720125f-a.text:
51l and 513 Grand Street, south side, between Henry Street and East Broadway, showing 2 old buildings with sloping roofs.

Apcil 1, 1937

Bernice Abbott, photo
Federal Art Project
720125f-a.folder: Grand Street & Henry Street., Manhattan, NY

720378f-a.text:
Henry Street, south side, west from Grand Street, showing the demolition of tenements extending to Scammel Street.  The All Saints Free Church is at the S.E. corner of that thoroughfare.

June 23, 1939

P. L. Sperr
720378f-a.folder: Henry Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

720381f-b.text:
(1)
Henry Street, looking west from near Grand Street and showing, All Saints Free Church, between Henry and Madison Streets.

View (2) and (3) Same.

P.L.Speer.
August 15, 1939.

720129f-a.text:
523 to 527 Grand Street, south side, at, adjoining and west of Henry Street, showing three 3-story frame structures. Shown across their roofs are Nos. 338 to 320 Henry Street, south side, between Jackson and Scammel Streets. This view is as seen from Columbia Street.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 298.

NEG. #5055
720129f-a.folder: Grand Street & Henry Street, Manhattan, NY

720382f-a.text:
Henry Street, north side, west from, No. 311, a point west of the N.W. corner of Grand Street.
March 23, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
720382f-a.folder: Henry Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

720383f-a.text:
(1)
315-323 Henry Street, west of the N.W. corner of Grand Street. Nos. 317-319 Henry Street, are 3-story frame houses, with brick fronts No. 321 Henry Street, is a 1-story frame shed.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 304.

(2)
The same, slightly more inclusive to show Nos. 313 and 311. This view shows Nos. 317 and 319 vacant and in a neglected state while the frame shed, No. 321 has been reconstructed in brick.
March 23, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
